data.name: Jie
data.aboutMe: I am a student software engineer who is passionate about creating new things. I am currently studying at the Monash University and I am looking for a full time role in the software industry. I am a fast learner and I am always looking to improve my skills. I am also a team player and I am always willing to help others.

projects.projectDescription: Researchify is a web application that allows researchers to publish websites for their research profiles on GitHub pages. It targets researchers without any programming nor graphic design knowledge. It is a full-year project provided by Monash University.

edJourney is an online platform where students can share a topic (also called a Journey) and learn form Journeys shared by others. Each Journey will have step-by-step milestones that guides a user to achieve a learning outcome. Users can also mark their learning progress with the progress bar feature.

data.name: Jerry
data.aboutMe: I am an Australian student currently studying at Monash Uni. I am passionate about software engineering, learning new technologies, and evolving or creating new ideas. I like to appreciate and be fascinated by the creative works of others. My ambition is to push VR experiences to its limits, and explore and pioneer innovative ways we can do this. I have extensive personal experience in VR game development for Unity. I am currently working on a VR game whilst studying.

projects.projectDescription: In the first scene there were three game elements that we wanted to focus on- Using light to induce awe, we wanted to try and regulate the player‚Äôs breathing, and we wanted to induce the dissolution of self. The dissolution of self was achieved by altering the player‚Äôs virtual body to look as if it had itself become water, and using post-processing effects such as increasing the intensity of chromatic aberration and the vignette.The purpose of this scene was to slowly ease the player into a relaxed state. The best approach to this is to try and regulate the player‚Äôs breathing. To achieve this, semi-transparent mushrooms that glow brightly were placed on the rocky side walls of the environment in the peripheral of the player‚Äôs view. Hallucinogens are mostly commonly associated with magic mushrooms, a type of fungi that contains the psychoactive compound, psilocybin

The space environment was chosen as the psychedelic scene. The backdrop in front of the player is a cosmic sized feminine gender-neutral human looking downwards with her/his hands cupped, as if holding water. Floating beside at head level are two distant planets with an animated psychedelic material. Surrounding the entire scene is a semi-transparent dome with an animated kaleidoscope-like shader applied. The humans and planets in the backdrop aim to give a sense of vastness. The player floats at the centre of an infinite open lane surrounded by various interesting compositions at the sides, spawning in an infinite loop towards the horizon. These compositions consist of various small islands with waterfalls. Some islands have iridescently colored humans sitting in a meditative pose. Most of these small islands have trees with continuously changing hues. A post-processing effect is added to slowly continuously change the hue of the entire scene, making the world feel alive with surreal colour. In this scene the player‚Äôs virtual body is removed. The reason for this is that we wanted to make this scene an OBE.
Developing a cyberpunk style VR survivor game. Here's a robot I made in blender
An LED audio visualiser I made for a university project. Reacts to audio in the surroundings. LED lights move outwards depending on volume of surroundings.

data.name: Chris
data.aboutMe: I am student software engineer and I love to code everyday.

projects.projectDescription: Users can pick a location on the map and record the exercise they did. Users can log their activity, time and make comments to track their progress. Whether it is running, team sport, or gym, an emoji will automatically be generated. It is a JavaScript-based application and uses the Leaflet API.

Users can share a sticky note with a message for everyone to see. They can also choose the colour of their sticky note. They can share a joke, their thoughts, have a vent...etc. It is a react based application using MongoDB to save the note and colour data.
